description:
Wilhelm von Littenheim was an Imperial Marquis, son-in-law to Kaiser http://anidb.net/ch206 [Friedrich IV] as the husband of his daughter Princess Christine, and one of the most influential nobles at court during the late Goldenbaum Dynasty. Like his rival and later ally Duke http://anidb.net/ch261 [Otto von Braunschweig], he was a staunch defender of the old order in the http://anidb.net/ch1534 [Empire] and opposed http://anidb.net/ch186 [Reinhard von Lohengramm] during the Imperial Civil War. However, Littenheim had no real martial talents and was defeated by Admiral http://anidb.net/ch187 [Siegfried Kircheis], whose fleet was half the size of the Marquis`s.
Marquis Littenheim was killed by http://anidb.net/ch82213 [one of his former subordinates] while at http://anidb.net/ch82218 [Garmisch Fortress] shortly after his defeat in battle.
Source: Gineipaedia
name: Wilhelm von Littenheim
